pages.md:
| Problem                        | Solution                                                                                                                                                      |
|-------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| No panorama is recorded when the shutter button is pressed. | The indicator lamp was orange when you attempted to record a panorama: Wait until the indicator lamp turns off (ðŸ“– 8).                                           |
| No face is detected.          | - The subjectâ€™s face is obscured by sunglasses, a hat, long hair, or other objects: Remove the obstructions (ðŸ“– 156).                                           |
|                               | - The subjectâ€™s face occupies only a small area of the frame: Change the composition so that the subjectâ€™s face occupies a larger area of the frame (ðŸ“– 156).   |
|                               | - The subjectâ€™s face is turned away from the camera: Ask the subject to face the camera (ðŸ“– 156).                                                                |
|                               | - FACE/EYE DETECTION SETTING is off: Turn FACE/EYE DETECTION SETTING on (ðŸ“– 156).                                                                               |
|                               | - The camera is tilted: Keep the camera level.                                                                                                                 |
|                               | - The subjectâ€™s face is poorly lit: Shoot in better light.                                                                                                      |
| No subject is detected.       | - The subject is partially hidden: Choose a vantage point where you can see as much of the subject as possible (ðŸ“– 158).                                        |
|                               | - The subject occupies only a small portion of the frame: Get closer to your subject so it occupies more of the frame (ðŸ“– 158).                                 |
|                               | - OFF is selected for SUBJECT DETECTION SETTING: Select SUBJECT DETECTION ON (ðŸ“– 158).                                                                          |
|                               | - The subject is poorly lit: Shoot in better light.                                                                                                            |

rows: No panorama is recorded when the shutter button is pressed.
The indicator lamp was orange when you attempted to record a panorama: Wait until the indicator lamp turns off (ðŸ“– 8).
- The subjectâ€™s face is obscured by sunglasses, a hat, long hair, or other objects: Remove the obstructions (ðŸ“– 156).
- The subjectâ€™s face occupies only a small area of the frame: Change the composition so that the subjectâ€™s face occupies a larger area of the frame (ðŸ“– 156).
- The subjectâ€™s face is turned away from the camera: Ask the subject to face the camera (ðŸ“– 156).
- FACE/EYE DETECTION SETTING is off: Turn FACE/EYE DETECTION SETTING on (ðŸ“– 156).
- The camera is tilted: Keep the camera level.
- The subjectâ€™s face is poorly lit: Shoot in better light.
- The subject is partially hidden: Choose a vantage point where you can see as much of the subject as possible (ðŸ“– 158).
- The subject occupies only a small portion of the frame: Get closer to your subject so it occupies more of the frame (ðŸ“– 158).
- OFF is selected for SUBJECT DETECTION SETTING: Select SUBJECT DETECTION ON (ðŸ“– 158).
- The subject is poorly lit: Shoot in better light.
